page.title: 07SAINT MARY'S CHURCH
page.content:
The church is notable, with its Norman tower and its mediaeval sexton's wheel fixed to the wall - a rare relic. A more recent acquisition is the White Altar Frontal (given to the church in 1972) the design of which incorporates representations of Long Stratton High School and the Health Centre, symbolising education and physical care in the village. The oldest tomestone in the graveyard was dated 1815.
In loving memory of Elizabeth the wife of John Howes Jnr. who died November 13th. 1815 aged 38 years.
